schema.description: Current page number, starting from 1
Number of entries per page
The unique identifier of a event
The potential hijacker AS of a BGP hijack event
The potential victim AS of a BGP hijack event
The potential hijacker or victim AS of a BGP hijack event
The country code of the potential hijacker or victim AS of a BGP hijack event
The prefix hijacked during a BGP hijack event
The minimum confidence score to filter events (1-4 low, 5-7 mid, 8+ high)
The maximum confidence score to filter events (1-4 low, 5-7 mid, 8+ high)
Shorthand date ranges for the last X days - use when you don't need specific start and end dates.
Start of the date range (inclusive).
End of the date range (inclusive).
Sort events by field
Sort order
Format results are returned in.

GET /radar/bgp/leaks/events.description: Get the BGP route leak events (Beta).

schema.description: Current page number, starting from 1
Number of entries per page
The unique identifier of a event
The leaking AS of a route leak event
ASN that is causing or affected by a route leak event
Country code of a involved ASN in a route leak event
Shorthand date ranges for the last X days - use when you don't need specific start and end dates.
Start of the date range (inclusive).
End of the date range (inclusive).
Sort events by field
Sort order
Format results are returned in.

GET /radar/bgp/routes/moas.description: List all Multi-origin AS (MOAS) prefixes on the global routing tables.

schema.description: Lookup MOASes originated by the given ASN
Lookup MOASes by prefix
Lookup only RPKI invalid MOASes
Format results are returned in.

GET /radar/bgp/routes/pfx2as.description: Lookup prefix-to-origin mapping on global routing tables.

schema.description: Lookup prefixes originated by the given ASN
Lookup origins of the given prefix
Return only results with matching rpki status: valid, invalid or unknown
Format results are returned in.

GET /radar/bgp/routes/stats.description: Get the BGP routing table stats (Beta).

schema.description: Single ASN as integer.
Location Alpha2 code.
Format results are returned in.

GET /radar/bgp/timeseries.description: Gets BGP updates change over time. Raw values are returned. When requesting updates of an autonomous system (AS), only BGP updates of type announcement are returned.

schema.description: Aggregation interval results should be returned in (for example, in 15 minutes or 1 hour intervals). Refer to [Aggregation intervals](https://developers.cloudflare.com/radar/concepts/aggregation-intervals/).
Array of names that will be used to name the series in responses.
For example, use `7d` and `7dControl` to compare this week with the previous week. Use this parameter or set specific start and end dates (`dateStart` and `dateEnd` parameters).
Array of datetimes to filter the start of a series.
End of the date range (inclusive).
Array of BGP network prefixes.
Array of BGP update types.
Array of comma separated list of ASNs, start with `-` to exclude from results. For example, `-174, 3356` excludes results from AS174, but includes results from AS3356.
Format results are returned in.

GET /radar/bgp/top/ases.description: Get the top autonomous systems (AS) by BGP updates (announcements only). Values are a percentage out of the total updates.

schema.description: Limit the number of objects in the response.
Array of names that will be used to name the series in responses.
For example, use `7d` and `7dControl` to compare this week with the previous week. Use this parameter or set specific start and end dates (`dateStart` and `dateEnd` parameters).
Array of datetimes to filter the start of a series.
End of the date range (inclusive).
Array of comma separated list of ASNs, start with `-` to exclude from results. For example, `-174, 3356` excludes results from AS174, but includes results from AS3356.
Array of BGP network prefixes.
Array of BGP update types.
Format results are returned in.

value.description: Percentage of updates by this AS out of the total updates by all autonomous systems.

GET /radar/bgp/top/ases/prefixes.description: Get the full list of autonomous systems on the global routing table ordered by announced prefixes count. The data comes from public BGP MRT data archives and updates every 2 hours.

schema.description: Alpha-2 country code.
Maximum number of ASes to return
Format results are returned in.

GET /radar/bgp/top/ases/prefixes.summary: Get list of ASNs ordered by prefix count

GET /radar/bgp/top/prefixes.description: Get the top network prefixes by BGP updates. Values are a percentage out of the total BGP updates.

schema.description: Limit the number of objects in the response.
Array of names that will be used to name the series in responses.
For example, use `7d` and `7dControl` to compare this week with the previous week. Use this parameter or set specific start and end dates (`dateStart` and `dateEnd` parameters).
Array of datetimes to filter the start of a series.
End of the date range (inclusive).
Array of comma separated list of ASNs, start with `-` to exclude from results. For example, `-174, 3356` excludes results from AS174, but includes results from AS3356.
Array of BGP update types.
Format results are returned in.
